review_blob: Terrific beer. This house culture does best when its young and bright! Any more than a few months in the bottle and shit starts going south.

review_blob: sweaty rotting citrus-meat and dirty musty sock aromas with powdery citrus-mold at the end. flavors are harshly astringent and perfume-solventy. this is way off the mark and just simply not good.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: fresh tart berries and subtle melon on the nose. dry,flavorful blackberry mouth with an assertive lemony tartness.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: Best approach to witbier that Ive seen. Using Saison yeast blended with wit yeast is the right way to do it in my opinion. subtle clove and pepper, more forward fruity yeast character, with beautiful haze, and a soft citrus sweetness.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: This beer is stellar. Complex, full of layered aromas and flavors of fermenting fruits, mild spice, flowers, oak, and tangy red fruits.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: floral, citrus, earthy, vanilla, hay, bread, golden, orange, hazy, medium sourness, long finish. tons of citrus and earth character. cool beer. So glad I got to try it.

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob:
This is for Cherry Lila From The Stone:

really special and beautiful floral and fruit perfume aroma. the aroma cannot be overstated. one of the best smelling beers Ive ever encountered.

however, the flavor is harsh, extremely metallic, and the mouth is both thin and creamy at the same time, but in a VERY unpleasant way. Almost chalky, like the mineral content got way out of hand...this could have maybe spent too long in the "concrete egg", or it could have been off from the get-go, which is a shame since it had such a truly memorable and wonderful aroma.
beer_name: Hair of the Dog Cherry Lila

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: this beer is perfect. anyone who doesnt realize this fact is a delusional self-obsessed fool concerned only with affectation and socially-imposed perception.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: strange yogurt-like mouthfeel leaving taste impressions of lactic-yogurt tartness. very strange and slightly unappetizing. aroma was cleaner and more tart citrus and a hint of tart grape (although that may just be Hallertau Blancs name-suggestion manipulating my memory of the experience...)

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: stellar pilsner that no one gives a shit about. dry, crisp, refreshing, rich malt flavor, appropriate bitterness in all the right places around the palate. damn good beer.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: heavy dill and herbal impressions. this version used Mandarin Bavaria and Cascade hops, I believe. decent intensity of aroma, just of a slightly off-putting herbaceous nature. very drinkable, little oily on the palate, but nothing too unpleasant.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: big fruity hops, thick yeast character, like classic Sasions, but theres a really crazy creaminess/lactose impression on the palate. Amazing flavor and aromas. Mango, Pepper, earth, good damn beer.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: killer. big citrus/fruitty hop presence, clean pilsner malt, mango, tangerines, slight tropical brett aromas happening. cool beer.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: stellar, man! sound fuckin weird but confident execution and technical awareness made for an incredible aromatic beer with serious implications of strawberry milkshake laced in its flavors.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: one of the best American-made Saisons Ive ever had. Bright, dry, aromatic notes of lemon zest and flowery black pepper, with a fruity freshness that makes the entire experience very mouth watering.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: another stellar bitter from TH! slightly more aggressive bitterness than they normally have in their bitters, but it goes very nicely.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: aggressive herbal lemon aromas come across overbearing and slightly unpleasant. the finish has a very nice clean malty character, and the flavor is present, but far too herbal and forward. a rare miss from THBC.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: damn nice beer. a forward lemon aroma with hints of bread dough underneath. very dry, very bright, very refreshing and enjoyable.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: appetizing aromas. not much in the way of citrus, as the ginger dominated both the aroma and flavor. not bad at all, but an almost too forceful ginger presence covers up any other more subtle character.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: not terrible. not great, the peach flavor comes from extract. but theres a half-way decent cream-type ale at the core of this beer and its not completely unenjoyable.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: something was terribly wrong in this glass. tasted like I was licking a handful of rusty pennies. either somebody needs to clean their draft lines, or somebody didnt measure their salt additions properly...maybe both.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: slightly tart, slight brett character, beautiful dry lemon-citrus experssions. truly a wonderful beer to drink.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: Clean flavors of slightly tart, earthy, oaked fruits. Hard to pinpoint exactly the fruit flavors, theres a bit of tart golden fruit as well as red berries. I suppose that would be "blush" fruit flavors. Very subtle though. Slight spice, flowers, tannic lightly tart grape flavors on the finish. Very light flavors throughout. Beautifully subtle and well made! Bone dry. REALLY DRY!

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob:
FLOWERS, TART RED BERRIES, CLEAN MODERATELY TART LACTIC ACID. SLIGHT WOODY/EARTH FUNK. SLIGHT SWEET OAK. PERFECTLY DRY. SUCH CHARACTER! SUCH PERFECT BALANCE AND MARRIAGE OF FLAVORS AND AROMAS.

This has to be one of the finest, most expressive, and delicious "Frambozenbiers" Ive ever tasted!

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: killer aromas and flavors of mild wheat, earthy fruits, apricot, peach, fermenting yeast. exceedingly clean on the palate though with a beautifully expressive layer of aromatic Galaxy hop flavors of mango and tropical citrus.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: This is a really nice showing of ryes spicy/earthy character. Theres a touch of chocolatey nuttiness hiding in it. Nice deep clear copper-red brown color. Subdued hop presence. Overall very well balanced and enjoyable.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: Not a great experience. Tasted overtly husky and woody in an unpleasant way. Also dead earthy hops. Im wondering if there is an infection at Historic, as Ive tasted off-flavors in almost all of their beers...

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: Big funky honey aroma, tons of tannic-bordering-on-astringent wood character. Taste is very dry, clean honey flavor without the sweetness. Very woody and up front. A great drink, if a bit forceful.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: Something may have been off about the batch I tasted. It had a slight but noticeable enterobacter presence, like cow manure. I could taste a viable Altbier underneath, but the off-flavors were unavoidably dominant on my palate.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: Stellar. Nose like candied violets, cotton candy, soft honey, and very slight essence of damp hay. Taste is smooth blueberry layered with medium dry apples. The perfect balance, barely enough sweetness to keep it from being bone dry, but definitely not a sweet cider. Fantastic.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: A decent beer. Good clean flavors, but the cherry flavoring is apparent, and that really disturbs me. It really is a nice porter at its core, but the cherry flavoring knocks it down,

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob:
very subdued hop character, even for an IBA. Im consistently disappointed in dark hoppy beers save for a few producers who seem to understand that dark malts inherently cover up subtle hop character.

Its a well made, clean, drinkable beer, but as an IBA, its very weak.,
beer_name: Mother Road Lost Highway Imperial Black IPA

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: This was NOT bad at all. It reminded me a lot of a paler version of Brasserie Bourganel Biere au Nougat. Clean, caramel/chocolate notes, restrained sweetness, and a fairly dry finish. It was enjoyable in small doses.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: This is a much better brown ale than its ratings would suggest. I dont understand why that is. nice body, beautiful caramel and nutty aromas, mild malt sweetness but dry enough to be clean on the palate. All around classic and well made.
beer_name: Golden Road Get Up Offa That Brown

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: This is the best out of all the Wanderlust beers Ive tried. Restrained acidity, nice mouthfeel. Again, the Hefeweizen banana esters come through too aggressively, though. It dominates too harshly compared to the clean lactic character of classic Leipzeiger gose. Still their best offering.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob:
I will admit that my personal preference for Farmhouse yeast strains plays into my rating of this. Overly estery in the bubblegum/banana vein of aromas, which turns me off. The taste had a very nice and characteristic cider-like quality to it. Much higher in alcohol content than I prefer in my farmhouse beers. Slightly phenolic spicy characteristics were exhausting to the palate, also. Medium-dry, and again, I really believe Saisons are better when much dryer than this one was. 

I give credit for finding an interesting blend of yeasts for this fermentation, but the sensory characteristics give off an overly-spicy Hefeweizen-mixed-with-brett yeast characteristic. Not bad, but not great.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob:
Not a bad attempt. A bit astringent, but overall acheived a nice mellow malt character. Yeast was a little misguided I feel. There was a subtle-yet-identifyable banana phenolic undertone to the character. I alwasy prefer clean fermentation for Bieres de Garde. Also tasted a bit young. Some additional time to smooth may have been a wise idea. 

Very drinkable, but also somewhat forgettable insomuch as it fails to really excel at any Biere de Garde characteristics.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: massive mango-citrus-peach flavors and aromas. subdued saison yeast character which allows the hops and citrus to come forward. great beer.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: amazing. insane tropical lime, citrus, and coconut notes. really beautiful amount of coconut layered in the finish. bright, with a pleasant body and balance. damn good beer.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: good amber. not great, but good and drinkable. appropriate caramel/biscuit notes. good full head.

user_location: of Grand Canyon Brewing Company Washington
review_blob: this is not a good hoppy beer. all caustic bitterness, no flavor or aroma extracted from their hops. also, slight acetate notes. i wish brewers who dont know how to utilize hops would stop throwing them away on mediocre beer.
